frames.desc: A drawing I made for my friend torcado.

frames.name: band
frames.desc: A collection of my characters in a school band.

frames.name: wonder
frames.desc: A perspective piece I did of one of my characters when I was experimenting with coloring lines.

frames.name: alright
frames.desc: An abstract piece I did of my sona character when I was experimenting with bolder color choices.

frames.name: purple gal
frames.desc: A character design I made on a whim.

frames.name: rubic.dev
frames.desc: The site you're looking at now.

frames.name: Beaker
frames.desc: A work-in-progress art program made in Electron with React.

frames.name: PolyominoSolver
frames.desc: A tool designed to solve polyomino fitting problems with an interface according to Google's material design. The UI wasn't finished, but the solver will work in your browser's console.

frames.name: Hex Stickers
frames.desc: A set of hexagonal stickers I made of various brands for my own personal use.

frames.name: Starlight
frames.desc: A trading card design intended to be used in an online card trading game called Starlight.

frames.name: Beaker
frames.desc: Various phases of design work for the UI of Beaker.

frames.name: Timekeep
frames.desc: A Unity game completed in one week for the Brackeys Jam 2020.2. I worked with three friends and handled all of the programming. We placed #29 out of 1,850 entries.

frames.name: Spots and Ears
frames.desc:
A narrative-focused platformer game that was created in Unity. I was the lone programmer working with a team of artists.

We finished a demo that was revealed at SHMCon in February of 2020.

frames.name: pawb.in
frames.desc: An online, in-browser creature collection game. Currently a work in progress.

frames.name: Dizzyship
frames.desc: A Unity game I completed in 48 hours for the GMTK Game Jam 2020. I worked solo and placed in the top 10% of 5,400 entries.

frames.name: Yarn
frames.desc:
A puzzle game that was created in Unity. I led the project design and taught a team of programmers how to use several development tools.

The final result is lacking significant functionality but overall the experience taught me a lot about team management.
